number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 12
												Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is considered by some as the game that put fps games into the modern era and others consider it as the game that ruined the fps genre for the modern era. I personally believe that it set a fundation that many fps games followed, (warmode maps are based off cod 4, sniper ghost warrior 2 is an attempt of recreating a mission from the campaign). Cod 4 was released in the November of 2007 and the last cod game with free dlc, the game was remastered late last year. *Please note* This is a campaign review (I'm experiencing performance issues with multiplayer and that will be added to the review once fixed).PositivesGreat graphics for time periodAmazing frame rate (no frame rate drops)Good voice actingThis game puts you in a scenario to determine the best difficulty for your skill levelGreat variety of missionsGreat variety of weaponsRPGs, rocket launchers, bombs and any other explosions are done perfectly'good guys' don't aways succeedThe game puts you in the perspective of multiple peopleStory and missions are set in multiple time periodsAllie characters have interesting and varied personalitiesMy teammates actually shot the enemies and actually kill some enemiesNegatives:Way to short about 5 hours longAI positioning and spawning areas and timing is lazy and dumb (game showing its age)All enemies look the same (again game showing its age)My teammates always cut me off or bump into me in the first mission or prologueOverall cod 4 is one of my favourites games and is a nice breath of fresh compared to modern games. This game had so much potential and only lived up to some of it. If they could of made the campaign 10-20 hours long then fixed AI spawning issues in the remaster and obviously update graphics we'd have two out of this world games. I rate the campaign a 8.5/10 and I know that people still play the multiplayer and we can even join servers down under. I got it for $13 AU on a humblebundle sale and it sits around the same price on♥♥♥♥♥or ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ so your definitely getting your moneys worth so why not buy it?

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
												My third stop in my journey to play all the CODs (for PC) in chronological order. Reviewed for its playability today.Pros:- Pretty good graphics- Decent story, although not particulary memorable- Some pretty sweet maps in the campaign- Great, simple multiplier with classes and ranks (and still lots of people playing)- Since this is the first of the COD games with their famous multiplayer features, it's as basic and un-bogged down as possible; good old fashioned, quick-paced gameplay- Runs smoothlyCons:- Campaign is pretty short - finished it in about 6-6.5 hours on advanced difficulty- You'll find yourself at the maximum multiplayer rank before too, too long (no prestige system or anything that I can see)- Some features you might miss from later games in multiplayer- Some cheesy dialogue in campaign, and I only found myself caring for about one or two other characters

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												There's no doubt as to why old school players prefer this Call of Duty game in comparison to the older versions of the series. The hitboxes are more accurate, the GUI is extremely simple and easy to grasp. Each gun has their own unique feel which really grasps the player into the game. The graphics from when the game was made is indeed playable, graphics isn't an issue in this game as the mechanics and engine run so smooth.I'd suggest getting this on PC due to cheat protection software, punkbuster. The servers are also player hosted and you get a server-list so that you can choose whether or not you want to play with mods and interfere with annoying hackers. Consoles do not offer this.And the campaign has a amazing story so I have no review on that for the time being because you need to enjoy it for yourself.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2016
												This stuff right here...is a legend among first person shooters. Much like doom, quake, unreal touranment, and Halo made awesome contributions to the FPS, so has infinity ward's first entry into the Modern era of shooters. I have enjoyed this game tremendously on the Xbox 360 and getting the PC version made it even better.Story: One of my favorite First Person Shooter campaigns to date, honestly it is brilliant and no other call of duty game has exceeded it (Except MW2 in my opinion) or matched it (black ops got close though) and few other FPS have matched it in story. However it is about 6 hours long so keep that in mind that the 20$ price tag might be too much. The game looks dated yes, 720p 60FPS on the Xbox 360 it's not hard to max out. I used the nvidia control panel honestly to spruce up the game's visuals. The game is brilliant and a ton of fun so it is was definitely worth 60$ back in 2007 but I don't know about now.Multiplayer: I honestly could not get it to work it kept crashing but there are fixes just look on youtube. The multiplayer as a remember it is amazing but with the community now I can't be sure.Bad Stuff: umm, multiplayer may not work for some I guess? and High priceFinal Verdict: If you feel confident that you can get the multiplayer to work the game is worth it's 20$ price tag. However If you can't I'd wait til it gets on sale.

Posted: December 24, 2016
												This game was the one that put Activision and the whole Call of Duty franchise on the map. But unlike the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ children that it spawned, COD4 is a prime example of "simple is better". There are 3 killstreaks, 3, and that's all you'd ever want because it is the gameplay, the brilliant maps, and the deadliest of deadly weaponry that count in this game. The proof is in the puddin' and this game brings buckets of it. Released in 2007 (as of this review this game is 10 years old).... and the online community has adored it, and promoted it to this day and for many years to come im sure.By far my favorite shooter game everTry it out once, glance up at the clock and realize that you've been playing for 12 hours straight... that's just what it does.ENVOY RATED: 10/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2016
												Most people who played this in its heyday call it the best Call of Duty, and it's not hard to see why.PROS:+A campaign which set a new standard for future Call of Duty games+Gameplay with modern features like ADS and regenerative health, but some classic features like leaning.+A simple, easy-to-follow plot without all of the levels of convolution shown in the sequels.+Awesome multiplayer with create-a-class and killstreaks, but without a lot of game-breaking things seen in later games.+The famous sniper level which everyone tries to remake nowadays, but none have done successfully.+Dedicated Servers!+Few hackers! You have to work to find them.+Free DLC!CONS:-Still some broken multiplayer options ie noob tubes, juggernaut perk, martyrdom, last stand, and frag x3. A number of servers auto-kick players for using these weapons/perks, though.-Some useless perks in Multiplayer, ie eavesdrop.-Little replayability beyond Multiplayer.If you loved CoD 4 in the old days, you can pick this up and play without worries. If you want a fun FPS to play, you can grab this and have a blast. It's easily one of the best games of the 2000s.

												One of the LAST non-cash grab call of duties on the market. The earlier CODS were made with love, passion and the release dates for each one were spaced out. We would soon find out that future call of duties were not going to be the same. Instead they take zero notice to the community and just come up with the regular bull-crap game machanics as the last one and maybe a jet pack in between. If you want to buy a non cash grab, non yes-man bull-wank then I suggest this, or anything before it and Modern warfare 2. The only reason I have played modern warfare 3 on consoles was because it carries the story of the game before.Dont give activision or any of those devs anymore money. They are greedy un-responsible devs that actually pay popular curators to give them good reviews. Such as IGN, every review from them is perfect "9/10 best shooter of the year" "most innovative shooter ever made, 8/10" does that not seem mysterious to anyone?If you want to watch a non-bribed honest and hilarious reviewer then watch Mack From worth a buy:https://www.youtube.com/user/worthabuyguys?gl=CA Its the same game everytime with the same squeaker camping, un-skillful and unfun game as the last one. every game is rated M by the ESRB but really this is for 5 year olds. Get this or Go get arma or the previous games if you want a decent shooter. Stay away from the rest!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												Pros:+ Good story with emphasis on the threats of our time.+ A strong atmosphere is set from the beginning with the intro mission and cut scenes.+ Great character build. Cpt. Price and the villains are very memorable.+ Weapons feel superior and powerful. You don't have to empty a whole clip into an enemy's face like in CoD2 to bring him down.+ The environments where the missions take place help to enhance the feeling of modern day warfare.+ Lot's of replay value.+ Tactical approach is supported instead of going in guns blazing.Cons:- The game's extremely short, the credits came up when I thought I was a quarter through.In general:Video games have it easy depicting modern day asymmetrical conflicts compared to historical battle arrangements. These in-and-out missions with a small number of participants involved go well with the 'one man army' concept that video games are bound to. I hated CoD 2 for that reason. World War 2 was anything but a place for a 'one man army'. It was quite the opposite, there were statistics on how many tens of thousands of men would be needed to advance 3-4 miles in Battle of Normandy and likewise. The gore, the confusion and the feeling of being overwhelmed were just not present in CoD 2. The feeling of having the upper hand on the battlefield feels just right in CoD4: Modern Warfare because the way wars are fought has changed.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2015
												This game has probably the best multiplayer out of all the other CoD games because of two things:Mods.Dedicated Servers....okay that said you should just pick up this one for it's multipalyer...]"BUT WHAT ABOUT DA CAMPAIN SURR?"Okay, if you actually give a sh!t about the campain, it's okay I guess. If you're a lazy f**k and just want to play multiplayer but don't wanna do the campain. Scroll down. The games starts you off with some borderline autistic charcter named Soap. The reason I say this is because Soap says nothing of value. Soap contributes as much plot as Speedwagon, he stands in the background awkwardly and does what he is told to do. Oh, and you are british I guess. You also have some guy named "Gas", who is named this because he farts alot.There's also some bearded guy with a gay hat named "Price", he yells at you by saying "Soap you muppet, do this or something...I don't know." you do some training and after being horrible and called a♥♥♥♥♥ Price says you're ready to go.You go onto a ship to check out whats on board, and then murder everyone for British pride. But then you find out "OH MY GOD PRICE A BOMB!", so as you start getting the f**k out of dodge, a plane says "HI HONEY I'M HOME FOR A IMPORTANT PLOT MOMENT OF BLACK SCREENS AND DISORIENTATION! DID YOU ALSO ASKED FOR A 'RUN TO THE FINISH IN A CERTAIN AMMOUNT OF TIME MOMENT?", as this happens, you hear some SAS bloke scream "JUMP FOR IT!", which is stupid, where am I jumping to exactly? The oceam? The Helicopter? This game never bothers to tell you so you just assume you jump to the heli.MEANWHILE, you go into the vision of some autistic quiet President named Obam-wait, sorry my bad, "Yasir Al-Fulani". This bloke goes through a silky smoth 30FPS level of seeing his country go to♥♥♥♥♥♥or something, also you see some♥♥♥♥♥in a blue jacket who is SPOILERS:Important late game, you starting to see a patern here? Oh, and Fulani gets shot in the face by some weeb named Khaled Al-Asad, who also happens to have a anime collection. Oh and he also has some golden Deagle, this made all the 12 year old boys go like "WHOAAAAA THAT DEAGLE SHOT WAS SO REALISTIC! AND HE ALSO HAD IT GOLD IT'S SOOOOO COOL!" I'm surprised he didn't miss that shot, the gold plating, holding the deagle with one hand, and trying to aim with sh!ty sunglasses should have made him miss his first shot.So now you go back to Soap and go to some place in russia or something to find some bloke that I forgot the name of, I think he's some resistance leader, also SPOILERS HE'S TOTS IMPORTANT AT THE END OF THE GAME XDDDDDDSpeaking of important charcters that will appear in either the "ending" or "next game", we meet NIKOLAI! (Who has a little bird in his pants) Nikolai is some ruskie that's important because "reasons" and you save him I guess.MEANWHILEEEEEEEUSA goes in and tries to blow everything up to kill Al-Asad, you know, rather than cuffin' him, taking him to a prision to rot, we do it in typical american fassion of "SHOOT ALL THE BROWN PEOPLE!"...i'm not joking, nobody every said "Hey, because he might be important, lets cuff him or something!", no, just shoot everyone. So here we play as some other borderline autistic kid named "Paul Jackson", he's an American soldier bloke who won't be with us long, more on that later.Anyway, not much plot here, just shoot some stuff I guess...i'm really not joking, there is some black guy who's cool I guess but you really just sort of shoot everything.Meanwhile, with Soap and friends! Your chopper gets shot down and you go do stuff, and there's an AC-130 segment, everyone thought it was cool but it was really just a drawn out turret segment.MEANWHILE AGAIN!You go back to Paul Jackson and shoot some more stuff and then you go to "WHO KNOWS" and shoot at some more stuff with the "SHOOT STUFF UP" brigade. Theres also some chick pilot you save I guess, not a good waifu though.Oh yeah and then theres a nuclear explosion and Paul dies from radiation because everyone is a casual scrub that dies to exploisions.Meanwhile with the Brits, Nikolai says some stuff about where Al-Asad is and then you go and shoot him a bunch, but THEN Price gets some phonecall n Al's phone and says "THAT BLOKE THAT CALLED ME WAS IMRAN ZAKHAEV!"So now we go throught he boulvard of broken dreams with flashbacks where we play as Price and some other autistic sniper bloke. You both shoot at a bunch of things and then shoot Zakhaev. *NOW I DON'T F**KING CARE WHAT YOU SAY, HE SHOULD HAVE DIED. HE LOST AN ARM, AND WAS BLEEDING EVERYWHERE. AND WAS SHOT BY A F**KING 50 CAL. NOBODY SHOULD EVER SURVIVE THAT AND THIS GAME'S LOGIC IS FLAWED.*Rant aside, Sniper bloke gets hurt and you go through a spooky mission with dogs. The end there.So now we are back with the SAS blokes who get shot at a bunch but get away because PLOT.And then we see the Black dude from the USMC come back, and now it's a Joint Op with USMC and SAS blokes, making it the "SLIGHTLY QUIET BUT AT THE SAME TIME LOUD BLOKES THAT BLOW STUFF UP" brigade.So in this next level called "The Sins of the Father", (No i'm not making a joke it's litterally called that.)You go to some base and cross dress as russian Prostitues to lure in Zakhaev's son. So he comes along and says "YO GIMMIE DA PUSSI BOSS!", but Gas says "NAW BOSS YOU UNDER ARREST!" and then Zakhaev's son in the gool ol' Japanese anime style fassion, shoots himself in the head....yeah there's no sugar coating there, he litterally just shoots himself. And then Zakhaev gets edgy about it and starts cutting himself to Linkin Park and Three Days Of Grace.You then find out "OH NOES! ZAKHAEV IS LAUNCHIN' NUKES!"So you go to the power station and Black Man gets captured, so you save Black Man and then walk around a bit and then OH MY JESUS CHRIST WTF!Yeah Zakhaev launches nukes.So you go in and start shooting at some ruskies and then you go inside the launch facility and then you find out OH HEY ZAKHAEV IS OVER THERE!So you race away and then get shot at by some helicopters who were related to Mr. Plot Plane from the begining of the game, and then you get horribly rekt because a bunch of SAS operators can't drive worth crap. A helicopter "SWHOSHES IN" and takes you all out. So heres what happens...Black guy dies first.Gas gets shot in the head/spine IDFK.Price throws a 1911 at you and says "SHOOT THEM YOU MUPPET!"And then you kill russian man Zakhaev.Also remeber the guy from the begining of the game I said would be important some how? Yeah the resistance leader says "YOU WILL BE ALL RIGHT COMMRADE! 99 BOTTLE OF VODKA ON THE WALL!"And then you get pulled away too space.THE END.  	tl;dr RUSSIANS, NUKES, AMERICA F**K YEAH, SAS BEST UNIT, KILL RUSSIAN MAN BLOKE.In all honesty, this story made more sense then all the other CoD games, so you should try out the story for "sh*ts" and giggles.Also theres a in-game cheat that turns on "Classic style" which speeds up the game a little and plays fancy music over everything.2/-1 It's okay.And probably the only good CoD game there will ever be for the rest of time.

content:
Posted: August 14, 2015
												This game has probably the best multiplayer out of all the other CoD games because of two things:Mods.Dedicated Servers....okay that said you should just pick up this one for it's multipalyer...]"BUT WHAT ABOUT DA CAMPAIN SURR?"Okay, if you actually give a sh!t about the campain, it's okay I guess. If you're a lazy f**k and just want to play multiplayer but don't wanna do the campain. Scroll down. The games starts you off with some borderline autistic charcter named Soap. The reason I say this is because Soap says nothing of value. Soap contributes as much plot as Speedwagon, he stands in the background awkwardly and does what he is told to do. Oh, and you are british I guess. You also have some guy named "Gas", who is named this because he farts alot.There's also some bearded guy with a gay hat named "Price", he yells at you by saying "Soap you muppet, do this or something...I don't know." you do some training and after being horrible and called a♥♥♥♥♥ Price says you're ready to go.You go onto a ship to check out whats on board, and then murder everyone for British pride. But then you find out "OH MY GOD PRICE A BOMB!", so as you start getting the f**k out of dodge, a plane says "HI HONEY I'M HOME FOR A IMPORTANT PLOT MOMENT OF BLACK SCREENS AND DISORIENTATION! DID YOU ALSO ASKED FOR A 'RUN TO THE FINISH IN A CERTAIN AMMOUNT OF TIME MOMENT?", as this happens, you hear some SAS bloke scream "JUMP FOR IT!", which is stupid, where am I jumping to exactly? The oceam? The Helicopter? This game never bothers to tell you so you just assume you jump to the heli.MEANWHILE, you go into the vision of some autistic quiet President named Obam-wait, sorry my bad, "Yasir Al-Fulani". This bloke goes through a silky smoth 30FPS level of seeing his country go to♥♥♥♥♥♥or something, also you see some♥♥♥♥♥in a blue jacket who is SPOILERS:Important late game, you starting to see a patern here? Oh, and Fulani gets shot in the face by some weeb named Khaled Al-Asad, who also happens to have a anime collection. Oh and he also has some golden Deagle, this made all the 12 year old boys go like "WHOAAAAA THAT DEAGLE SHOT WAS SO REALISTIC! AND HE ALSO HAD IT GOLD IT'S SOOOOO COOL!" I'm surprised he didn't miss that shot, the gold plating, holding the deagle with one hand, and trying to aim with sh!ty sunglasses should have made him miss his first shot.So now you go back to Soap and go to some place in russia or something to find some bloke that I forgot the name of, I think he's some resistance leader, also SPOILERS HE'S TOTS IMPORTANT AT THE END OF THE GAME XDDDDDDSpeaking of important charcters that will appear in either the "ending" or "next game", we meet NIKOLAI! (Who has a little bird in his pants) Nikolai is some ruskie that's important because "reasons" and you save him I guess.MEANWHILEEEEEEEUSA goes in and tries to blow everything up to kill Al-Asad, you know, rather than cuffin' him, taking him to a prision to rot, we do it in typical american fassion of "SHOOT ALL THE BROWN PEOPLE!"...i'm not joking, nobody every said "Hey, because he might be important, lets cuff him or something!", no, just shoot everyone. So here we play as some other borderline autistic kid named "Paul Jackson", he's an American soldier bloke who won't be with us long, more on that later.Anyway, not much plot here, just shoot some stuff I guess...i'm really not joking, there is some black guy who's cool I guess but you really just sort of shoot everything.Meanwhile, with Soap and friends! Your chopper gets shot down and you go do stuff, and there's an AC-130 segment, everyone thought it was cool but it was really just a drawn out turret segment.MEANWHILE AGAIN!You go back to Paul Jackson and shoot some more stuff and then you go to "WHO KNOWS" and shoot at some more stuff with the "SHOOT STUFF UP" brigade. Theres also some chick pilot you save I guess, not a good waifu though.Oh yeah and then theres a nuclear explosion and Paul dies from radiation because everyone is a casual scrub that dies to exploisions.Meanwhile with the Brits, Nikolai says some stuff about where Al-Asad is and then you go and shoot him a bunch, but THEN Price gets some phonecall n Al's phone and says "THAT BLOKE THAT CALLED ME WAS IMRAN ZAKHAEV!"So now we go throught he boulvard of broken dreams with flashbacks where we play as Price and some other autistic sniper bloke. You both shoot at a bunch of things and then shoot Zakhaev. *NOW I DON'T F**KING CARE WHAT YOU SAY, HE SHOULD HAVE DIED. HE LOST AN ARM, AND WAS BLEEDING EVERYWHERE. AND WAS SHOT BY A F**KING 50 CAL. NOBODY SHOULD EVER SURVIVE THAT AND THIS GAME'S LOGIC IS FLAWED.*Rant aside, Sniper bloke gets hurt and you go through a spooky mission with dogs. The end there.So now we are back with the SAS blokes who get shot at a bunch but get away because PLOT.And then we see the Black dude from the USMC come back, and now it's a Joint Op with USMC and SAS blokes, making it the "SLIGHTLY QUIET BUT AT THE SAME TIME LOUD BLOKES THAT BLOW STUFF UP" brigade.So in this next level called "The Sins of the Father", (No i'm not making a joke it's litterally called that.)You go to some base and cross dress as russian Prostitues to lure in Zakhaev's son. So he comes along and says "YO GIMMIE DA PUSSI BOSS!", but Gas says "NAW BOSS YOU UNDER ARREST!" and then Zakhaev's son in the gool ol' Japanese anime style fassion, shoots himself in the head....yeah there's no sugar coating there, he litterally just shoots himself. And then Zakhaev gets edgy about it and starts cutting himself to Linkin Park and Three Days Of Grace.You then find out "OH NOES! ZAKHAEV IS LAUNCHIN' NUKES!"So you go to the power station and Black Man gets captured, so you save Black Man and then walk around a bit and then OH MY JESUS CHRIST WTF!Yeah Zakhaev launches nukes.So you go in and start shooting at some ruskies and then you go inside the launch facility and then you find out OH HEY ZAKHAEV IS OVER THERE!So you race away and then get shot at by some helicopters who were related to Mr. Plot Plane from the begining of the game, and then you get horribly rekt because a bunch of SAS operators can't drive worth crap. A helicopter "SWHOSHES IN" and takes you all out. So heres what happens...Black guy dies first.Gas gets shot in the head/spine IDFK.Price throws a 1911 at you and says "SHOOT THEM YOU MUPPET!"And then you kill russian man Zakhaev.Also remeber the guy from the begining of the game I said would be important some how? Yeah the resistance leader says "YOU WILL BE ALL RIGHT COMMRADE! 99 BOTTLE OF VODKA ON THE WALL!"And then you get pulled away too space.THE END.  	tl;dr RUSSIANS, NUKES, AMERICA F**K YEAH, SAS BEST UNIT, KILL RUSSIAN MAN BLOKE.In all honesty, this story made more sense then all the other CoD games, so you should try out the story for "sh*ts" and giggles.Also theres a in-game cheat that turns on "Classic style" which speeds up the game a little and plays fancy music over everything.2/-1 It's okay.And probably the only good CoD game there will ever be for the rest of time.

content:
Posted: May 29, 2014
												I've just beaten the game, My thoughts so far: this game is awesome. The gameplay is dynamic. There's no way to stop moving or shooting. You will always face an enemy.What's more, it's full of checkpoints, so that you don't repeat your actions again and again. Be aware: for this reason, the game is quite short. But that's not a problem: the game follows a story, and there's no reason to extend it.That's what SP has to offer.In my opinion, the MP is not good like SP: it's all about running and shooting. There's no "feel" in it.If you're only interested in MP, don't buy it.Otherwise, do it. The game will offer you plenty of fun.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 14, 2016
												When you think of makes a good FPS game, you must look at the past.  Call of Duty 4 aka Cod 4 was my frist ever FPS i picked up back in 2007.  I feel in love with game game as soon as i loaded up the first level of the campaign.  The missions were so much fun and i always made sure to get each piece of intel on each mission.  It gave me a purpose to play the campaign becasue i wanted to see hoe clever the Dev's could be at hiding their locations.  Multiplayer: I have no words to describe how good & balanced the online realm is.  All guns feel super strong and i feel like im doing a lot of damage with each shot i take.  This game has been out for 9 years and i still come back to it each day i can.  That says a lot about a game when you still have the drive to play it after so long.  I would highly reccommend this game to anybody who wants to experience a truly good FPS.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												I should preface this with the admittance that I am not a fan of First Person Shooters.  I played the original Medal of Honor and Call of Duty games before the franchises became more focused on special effects, shock value, and multiplayer than they were about storylines; but I had a falling out with the story when $60 games couldn't be expected to offer any more than three hours of enjoyment outside of dealing with the horde of snotty kids online.I did, however, play through Modern Warfare 1 and 2 as they went on sale, and I was thoroughly impressed.  As you can expect just by looking at the store page, the game is visually stunning.  What you don't see, however, is the storylines (plural) that you follow as Army Rangers and Spec Ops fight to ensure America's continued global dominance amidst emerging threats (MW 1) and to ensure America's survival as all hell breaks loose (MW 2).  While the single player game is challenging (frustratingly so on some parts), the story line only gives you about 5 - 6 hours of gameplay and doesn't offer any outside-of-story single player enjoyability as you would see in Modern Warfare 2.All in all, I'd give the game an 6/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2011
												Still the best first person shooter around. It had everything, it was set in the present (instead of the now boring WWII scenarios), had a great, really great, story, all kinds of different missions (sniper, plane and vehicle for example) and it played wonderfully. The story just sucked you right in, the graphics looked awesome and realistic. And it didn't matter that it was short; it had non-stop action; there was not one boring moment in the entire game. Add to that the multiplayer that really did some new stuff as well, and there you go, the best FPS still around. Games don't get much better than this.[Rating: 97/100]

												Campaign: Loved it. I liked the parts in it where you had to just snipe and nothing else. I just wish it was longer than it was. 10/10Multiplayer: Sweet baby Jesus, it could not get any worse. The hackers were in almost every lobby. After a while of getting destroyed by hackers, the match gets repetitive and you're just thinking "oh my ♥♥♥♥ing god, just let this end already". Literally would give the multiplayer 1/10 or 2/10 top. So really overall if you just play CoD for the multiplayer, which a lot of people do, then do not even think of getting the game. But if you are planning just to do the campaign and leave multiplayer alone, then I would definately recommend it. I like playing multiplayer a lot so I do not recommend it.

content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
												Multiplayer: "Boots game up" gets on Broadcast -> joins USMC-> goes on noob tube spree -> victory -> HOORAH MARINES! 11/10 Nostalgic 2009 memories.  Campaign: "Boots up campaign" -> Passes price's exam -> Kills all drunken crew Russians, and steals le clipboard on the package-> Ship explodes -> "BIG BIRD THIS IS BRAVO SIX WERE ON OUR WAY OUT! ON YOUR FEET SOLDIER! WE ARE LEAVING!"- Price -> Escapes ship and jumps for it, le ship in background about to sink -> Le el president gets shot by Al-Asad (Well for christ sakes that's so messed up) -> Le marines land in Middle East and fighting intensifies for quite the time -> Marines get nuked in the distance (Ahem it's revealed Makarov detonated the nuke with Yuri watching in the distance) -> Le helicopter crashes -> R.I.P Vasquez, Jackson, etc (Le crying) -> Joint ops begins with SAS and USMC -> Le final attack on Russian ultranists -> Le stops nukes from detonating the world -> "Game Over" -> Fuel truck explodes -> Griggs gets noscoped in the head while pulling Soap -> Zakahev kills Gaz along with everyone else -> Price slides le pistol and le shoots Zakahev and his soldiers -> Le ending with loyalists rescuing Price and Soap -> The credits roll and AC-130 mission with the cannons blowing up enemies (okay way too boring!) -> exits credits -> opens campaign mission selection -> "Epilogue" -> "Don't call me shirley!" -One-One operative -> le intense rock music "LISTEN UP YALL" -> Saves hostage and parachutes out to safety -> Le photograph of price with Vasquez, Gaz, and Griggs R.I.P -> Screenshots photo and saves it. BEST GAME EVER!!! THIS CAMPAIGN MADE ME CRY MANLY TEARS AT THE END FOR THE CHARACTERS THAT WERE KILLED OFF!The difficulty of the game is balanced going from Recruit to Veteran. Almost like halo with Easy & Legendary. Recruit: If your too scared of dying you start with this. "Laugh as slow AI try try to take you down with much fire power but instead you kill them quicker, except let's not forget you take less damage"Regular: Unlike recruit you take normal damage and its still a bit easy also. "Your skills will be tested against AI with programed tasks of taking you down"Hardened: Now it begins to get harder, on hardened enemies have increased health and bullet damage is heavier. "Hardened is like Heroic, the AI will behave a bit more skillfully and different strategies must be used. Examples are headshots and using your flash bangs and grenades carefully."Veteran: If your ready to rip your hair off for each time. Then be prepared to order your hair regrowing sample kit. Haha I'm kidding. Veteran is the highest difficulty and the most insane that some players have a hard time passing the first level on it. "Face death over and over as enemy AI have double health, double damage and move in different patterns" I do suggest you work your way up with the difficulties and try to do headshots on veteran, it does kill the AI quicker.

content:
Posted: February 10
												What the hell kind of name is Soap!???Following on from the successful Call of Duty 2, developer Infinity Ward moves to modern warfare with Call of Duty 4. Story: Modern Warfare starts off normally enough, with the opening mission guiding the player through a training session involving firearm use as well as general movement of the character. However, once we hit the second mission things start to get interesting. It involves a SAS soldier by the name of John "Soap" MacTavish who is after a package on a Estonian Freighter. This mission is tense, exciting and memorable and sets the tone for the rest of the missions in the game. The pacing of the story is superb and never do you feel at any point that the campaign is boring to play through or lacks variety. Each mission is designed expertly and contains memorable characters, level design and scenarios. The story was easy to follow and is the start of the Modern Warfare storyline.Graphics: The game has started to show its age and rightfully so, as it was released a full decade ago. Textures look muddy by today's standards and there is not much detail in the character models, vehicles and weapons. They all look pretty basic. As a result, it would be difficult for this generation of gamers to completely immerse into the experience and they may not enjoy the game as much.Sound: Gunfire, soldier's screams and the whir of vehicles are captured accurately and sound authentic. You really do feel like you are in the midst of a battlefield when these sounds effects go off and credit to Infinity Ward for having excellent sound designers. The voice acting is also superb. Each voice actor brings an authentic performance to the table which allows the personalities of the characters such as Captain Price to shine as well as depicting emotion well.Gameplay: The gameplay of Call of Duty 4 has set the benchmark for all other FPS games to follow. It is fast, frenetic and highly addictive. Controls are tight and it feels very smooth to move your character around the level and aiming is easy to accomplish and highly accurate. It often feels very satisfying to land a kill may it be in the single-player campaign or multiplayer. In regards to multiplayer, it is still active to this day and at any given hour you should be able to enter a server filled with people and play.In summary, Call of Duty 4 - Modern Warfare is an outstanding first-person shooter game. It has redefined the modern FPS and its formula of having blockbuster action set-pieces and zippy gameplay has been copied over and over again. It is a must-play for any gamer.9/10.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												At this point in time the graphics look dated compared to what they were in 2007. That being said this game is a console port, so it was never meant to look amazing. It's just as fun as when it came on on the single player side. Multiplayer has all but died off much like Chernobyl. It's hard to no recommend this game being that it changed the FPS genre completely. Modern shooters today are what they are because of what this game accomplished. When COD4 was released it was a shining light of what the future would hold, unfortunately the franchise became a cash money grab and filled and filled with run and gun mechanics. If you want a game with a decent story, good shooting mechanics this is it. But don't be surprised when you're not rewarded for using tactics, this isn't Counter Striker after all.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Wow... This is where it all began people. No stupid overpowered 1-hit-kill pistol shot to the foot known as GHOSTS, but a real FPS at its origins,The campaign is by far the best one in the entire CoD franchise. There's good pacing, ♥♥♥♥ing excellent stand out moments and you don't spend every mission shooting foreigners who don't deserve it.The multiplayer is...broken. Well, it is somewhat fixable, but you shouldn't have to wave through 50 google searches to fix the problems. The first problem is punkbuster, the anti cheat. It's not being updated anymore so some people have to upadte it manually. Servers don't show up unless you spend 10 minutes replacing some random DLL file. I can't join ANY of the servers without getting kicked, so I have to use GameTracker to find a server that works for me!Currently the only server I can even use properly is Europe Cracked (Which you can find on Gametracker.com/cod4 google it) And it's 24/7 TDM. The game is awesome, but I recommend buying the Retail Version (I heard it's not as buggy as this version.The Cod franchise died with MW3. Rest in piece, you will always be remembered.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2012
												This is the game that revolutionized an entire franchise, and even perhaps an entire genre. Whether or not Modern Warfare has done so for the better is debatable, but make no mistake that this entry Call of Duty has had an enormous impact on the games we play today.On the single player side, Modern Warfare offers nothing more than a generic plot with repetitive gameplay elements. You hide in cover and eliminate waves of enemies. There are a few spectacular set pieces, but not enough to have me praise the campaign whole heartedly.The multiplayer is a fast paced, adrenaline pumping, and solid first person shooter. Every key stroke translates into an immediate reaction. Immediately gunning down foes with a few clicks is undoubtedly satisfying. The only downsides are the kill streaks which reward good players, putting casual players at a disadvantage and the swiftness of your demise.As a game which style is now heavily borrowed by others, Modern Warfare is worth a look.Grade: B

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												At this point in time the graphics look dated compared to what they were in 2007. That being said this game is a console port, so it was never meant to look amazing. It's just as fun as when it came on on the single player side. Multiplayer has all but died off much like Chernobyl. It's hard to no recommend this game being that it changed the FPS genre completely. Modern shooters today are what they are because of what this game accomplished. When COD4 was released it was a shining light of what the future would hold, unfortunately the franchise became a cash money grab and filled and filled with run and gun mechanics. If you want a game with a decent story, good shooting mechanics this is it. But don't be surprised when you're not rewarded for using tactics, this isn't Counter Striker after all.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2011
												CoD4: Modern Warfare, the release that showed the hieght of the Call of Duty series' prowess. Absolutely excellent storytelling, suprising-as-hell twists that really manages to leave you feeling like you've been punched in the stomach (in a good way) and a multiplayer that was great and open to modding.Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is the top of the tri-angle and for good reason. It is the first of the series to implement kill-streaks without going over-the-top, it is also the last of the Infinity Ward games that provides a believable and compelling story that gives you the proper highs and lows rather than just simply pumping you up over and over.CoD4's story is the closest you get to a military "drama" in that it properly uses the highs and lows of successes and failures. It has one of the most believable stories of the series while mantaining the fresh coat of "modern".

content:
Posted: June 18, 2016
												Single player review:Decent game, the usual "shoot them up". Not much replayability value, so get it cheap. Liked:Some of the acting was surprisingly good.Disliked:Cheats. As in, they make it insanely annoying to try to use them in single player mode. Listen, I've gone through the game several times, now I just want to screw around a bit. It's my game, on my computer, I'm not trying to cheat in multiplayer (there's enough others doing that, damned if I'm going to play with them in the first place).Yes, I can get most of the cheats to work. God mode, ignore ammo usage, etc. Then, suddenly, the game just disables it and cheats stop working. In the middle of a battle (usually at some sort of transition). Attempting to re-enable the cheats fails, game just ignores the commands.  Very, very annoying, and limited the replay for me even more.I'd recommend it, but get the game really, really cheap, because you won't be playing it very long if, like me, you aren't a fan of multiplayer.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Wow... This is where it all began people. No stupid overpowered 1-hit-kill pistol shot to the foot known as GHOSTS, but a real FPS at its origins,The campaign is by far the best one in the entire CoD franchise. There's good pacing, ♥♥♥♥ing excellent stand out moments and you don't spend every mission shooting foreigners who don't deserve it.The multiplayer is...broken. Well, it is somewhat fixable, but you shouldn't have to wave through 50 google searches to fix the problems. The first problem is punkbuster, the anti cheat. It's not being updated anymore so some people have to upadte it manually. Servers don't show up unless you spend 10 minutes replacing some random DLL file. I can't join ANY of the servers without getting kicked, so I have to use GameTracker to find a server that works for me!Currently the only server I can even use properly is Europe Cracked (Which you can find on Gametracker.com/cod4 google it) And it's 24/7 TDM. The game is awesome, but I recommend buying the Retail Version (I heard it's not as buggy as this version.The Cod franchise died with MW3. Rest in piece, you will always be remembered.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2014
												This game has a multiplayer mode and singleplayer. The singleplayer is good fun and can be quite cultivating, although lacks strong replay value. The multiplayer, where the focus of attention is, has unfortunately reached a state of decay. Unfortunately, nowadays, the only things you'll find are 24/7 Crossfire/Killhouse, some absurd zombie mod, or some terrible custom map that only allows for usage of the M40A3 sniper rifle. These are not of enjoyment, and it's unlikely a recovery will be made any time soon.6/10, was noticably better 10 years ago

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
												Call of Duty 4 is an amazing game, the campaign is as fun as can be. If you're looking to replay the campaign and enjoy the nostalgia, or have another chance at playing the legendary mission, "All Ghillied Up", then I have to recommend this game.HOWEVER, if you want to experince the greatness that was CoD 4 multiplayer, then I have some terrible news for you, don't even buy the game if thats your intention. Nearly every single multiplayer server is modded in some way, and makes every gun kill you in one shot, or completely changes the experince, because apperantly, modding the ♥♥♥♥ing game to obilvion is more fun than playing the original game. All of these modded servers ruin the experince. Of course this wouldn't be a problem if there were servers that were not modded, but thats not the case, nearly all of the servers are modded. The fact that so many people have modded nearly all of the multiplayer servers has ruined the whole nostalgic experince for me, and its very frustrating. Don't buy this ♥♥♥♥ing game if you want to play the multiplayer, because you'll get nothing but a bunch pointless mods that make playing matches utterly unenjoyable. If you like mods, then go for it. And if you see anyone in the Positive Review section for this game telling you that the game is balanced and fun to play, they're lying to you, and have obviously not played multiplayer for more than 2 minutes.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												Ok, lets get started. (WARNING SPOILERS AHEAD)Pros: Almost no hackers in multiplayer.         Single player has a good enough story.         It's at least better than infinite warfare.         It has close-to-realistic physics. Cons: The sniper rifles do not kill within one hit in multiplayer. I have hit people in the head and they dont die.          In singleplayer, you are almost always spotted in the stealth missions. Especially in "All Ghillied Up".          Annoying teams where the enemy sets all their C4 in a corner.          Almost all maps are made like they are for the sniper. I swear, every corner you go to, there is a camping sniper with the M21 ready to hip fire and spray your a$$.          That one guy on your team that flashes you untill you die. (Im talking about that perk that lets you have multiple grenades)Ok, there may be more cons than pros, but somehow, the game is still good and addicting.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												FPS Perfected. It would not be a stretch to say that CoD’s initial try at a modern FPS not only set the groundwork for how big the franchise is today, but has also inspired the genre to be as big and as multi-player focused as it now is. Out of all the games on the 50% off list, this will be the one you’ll least regret. From a single-player standpoint, IW finally stuck to telling a single narrative and it worked. It was the first game that, to me, felt like a purposeful story. Characters were made to appear more personable, but don’t really stand out until later on in the franchise. Team AI hardly got in the way while also being useful, and enemy AI was firm but fair. Although it would be unfair for me to criticize the game for its monotony in killing hordes of enemies, it would have been nice to be able to do so in more creative fashions (i.e. more AC-130-like levels and levels that required more driving or stragegy). Luckily, this is expanded upon in the franchise and was still more than I could have ever asked for out of a game that’s almost 10 years old. But the obvious winner and the main reason why this game has more players on it than the latest installment of the franchise (Infinite Warfare(IW)) comes down to its multiplayer. Nostalgia aside, the maps, weapons, and well-designed perk systems still hold up and are emulated in your most cherished FPS. The challenge systems for weapon attachments and XP were also a nice touch, including the implementation of camos and golden weapons. Even though the graphics aren’t on par with today’s titles, there’s still enough content in there to keep you engaged. It just bites that the prestige system was only on console systems and the latest remaster - but I still won’t give in to that darn cash grab with IW. Whether you buy it to relive the glory days, or you’re buying it to see what a genre-defining FPS is like - there’s no reason to not have this title in your library.

Cause I sure had fun pitching up a tent and sitting there.Either way 10/10, been too long since I played this game but I enjoyed it immensely, I should replay the storyline again it was great.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												This game is what people say turned the call of duty franchise around forever and I will be talking about what it did wright and what it did wrong.Cons- Everyone is rank 55 so if you have the balls to go up against these guys you're in for a fight- Everyone runs around with AK's, MP5's and M4's so if you are low on ammo and don't like these guns then good luckPros- The campaign is incredible and you should definatley play it if you want to because there is the best level in call of duty in my opinion- Not everybody runs around with noob tubes (under mounted grenade launchers) which makes it acually playable- Not all of the good guns are locked to higher levels so you won't have to wait to rank 3000 to get a good gun (the level cap is 55, I was exaggerating)- The gameplay mechanics are simple and easy to understand and the controls are pretty simple- There are no overpowered killstreaks because the game only has 3 so you don't have to worry about some guy destroying your team with pavelows and harriers- It has dedicated servers so you don't have to wait for 5 minutes while trying to find a game and a bonus is that you can have up to 50 people in the game at any point which makes some amazing games that you will remember.- If you don't like the built in modes there are some pretty cool mods that you should try out like a cool zombies mode and freeze tag.sorry for any bad grammer or spelling

content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												One of the finest Call Of duty campaigns. Some of the levels feel a little badly designed, such as the mission in which your supposed to fight your way down through a village to reach extraction when it's quicker to run through them all and wait for your team mates to catch up but for the most part its excellent. I especially like the main focus on the SAS and that first mission aboard the ship is one of my favourite in CoD history. The game also features one of the best final levels in a game.This is also the first part of the modern Captain Price trilogy, one of my favourite game characters.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												FPS Perfected. It would not be a stretch to say that CoD’s initial try at a modern FPS not only set the groundwork for how big the franchise is today, but has also inspired the genre to be as big and as multi-player focused as it now is. Out of all the games on the 50% off list, this will be the one you’ll least regret. From a single-player standpoint, IW finally stuck to telling a single narrative and it worked. It was the first game that, to me, felt like a purposeful story. Characters were made to appear more personable, but don’t really stand out until later on in the franchise. Team AI hardly got in the way while also being useful, and enemy AI was firm but fair. Although it would be unfair for me to criticize the game for its monotony in killing hordes of enemies, it would have been nice to be able to do so in more creative fashions (i.e. more AC-130-like levels and levels that required more driving or stragegy). Luckily, this is expanded upon in the franchise and was still more than I could have ever asked for out of a game that’s almost 10 years old. But the obvious winner and the main reason why this game has more players on it than the latest installment of the franchise (Infinite Warfare(IW)) comes down to its multiplayer. Nostalgia aside, the maps, weapons, and well-designed perk systems still hold up and are emulated in your most cherished FPS. The challenge systems for weapon attachments and XP were also a nice touch, including the implementation of camos and golden weapons. Even though the graphics aren’t on par with today’s titles, there’s still enough content in there to keep you engaged. It just bites that the prestige system was only on console systems and the latest remaster - but I still won’t give in to that darn cash grab with IW. Whether you buy it to relive the glory days, or you’re buying it to see what a genre-defining FPS is like - there’s no reason to not have this title in your library.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2015
												It has its moments. The Call of Duty series from 3 and onward had started to become a fairly straight line, with some things to pick up on the way. The series now seems to 'innovate' by the means of inventing a new game mechanic and only using it for a couple levels, never deviating from the Call of Duty formula of straight line run and gun with cinematic moments. This game was the one that did it right before the ones after it screwed it all up. The cinematics don't completely run your game, should you mess up it's your fault, which is a refreshing change if you've played the more recent Call of Duty games before this one like me. Would I say this is a good game? Ehhhhh... would I say it's a good Call of Duty game? Yes, the best after 3; and if the franchise keeps going as it is, that might remain true forever.In summary, like mentioned above, it has its moments. I didn't feel like my hand was being held during the campaign, and that if I didn't keep close to my squad and work with them that I'd probably get myself or all of us killed. At the same time, the singleplayer doesn't have too much replayability due to its straight line cinematic nature, except to play those key moments in the game again. I'm not going to rate based on the multiplayer, because I haven't played it and I don't really intend to... and multiplayer in Call of Duty games is expected to be good. Given all the information and my own opinion, I recommend this game if you are a fan of Call of Duty and its later games after 3. If you don't really care too much for Call of Duty or never played it, but intend on trying to get in to it, I'd recommend this one for the campaign. It touches on some interesting points, utilizes cool ideas for levels, and despite the occasional hollywood moments, manages to bring a small feeling of actual modern warfare in some of its missions.

content:
Posted: April 16, 2016
												I'm on the border of a negative review but I can't. The characters, the story, the gameplay, and the multiplayer all blended together to make one of my favorite fps games of all time (top 3). The only problem I found is that the punkbuster and multiplayer is by default out-dated and doesn't work. So I went through the steps to fix it and replaced the files and whatnot. But everytime I want to play multiplayer it just resets back and the servers don't show up. Its the server cache file that just never wants to work after the game has been put awayFor that reason, I am waiting for my refund and will return to mw1 on ps3

content:
Posted: November 23, 2016
												50 thousands kiddies used to play this. Now they're all above their twenties.I still remember the day when I played MW1 for the first time. It was like the winter of '08 and my poor Radeon X1300 with it's ol' good friend P IV 3.0 Ghz provided me unique 30fps-on-minimal-settings experience but it was something special anyway. Almost 10 years passed on and I still do know where to lie on that freaking plain to pass "All Ghilled Up" misson on Veteran difficulty. I still can do a pretty nice kill streak with my fav' m40a3. There are the best memories of both multiplayer and singleplayer gaming in there and I have a couple of words to Infinity Ward and Activision as well after new Call Of Duty games: "Mission Failed, We'll Get Em' Next Time".

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												Call of Duty 4, a game that no one should ever disrepsect. Even after the 7 years (8 years in 3 days) the game is still hilariously fun to play, with friends or by yourself.         With all the mods like Death Run, Hide & Seek, etc. The game may not be the same as it was the 7 years ago that it was made, but it haas obtained more of the funny moments. Even though you can't searach the server list without seeing,"HIGHXP 300XP / KILL!" it still has the fun aspect of that, you can mess around with your friends and randoms without having to bother about levels like you did on the consoles 7 years ago.         CoD:4 was the game that got me into gaming, and I still play it to this day! Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare is a game to be owned by all FPS players and all steam members, even if the PC you own cannot run it.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2014
												This is the best Call of Duty game overall, with an awesome single player experience coupled with an even better multiplayer counterpart. Visuals 10/10 : Excellent level design set in war-torn areas in the Middle-East and Eastern Europe. Even though this game was released in 2010 when run on max settings the textures look incredible. Soundtrack 8/10 : Great sound quality with a decent sountrack accompaniment.Gameplay 10/10 : Infinity Ward crafted an incredible balance of FPS game mechanics, and when experienced on a modern system is one of the smoothest shooters of its kind. The maps lend themselves to thoughtful firefights with an emphasis on teamwork.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												Arma 3 is a must-have game for those looking to have a realistic and immersive experience. However, this is not provided by the game itself, but by the communities that make this game bring out it's full potential.Phantactical, for example, focuses on casual realism and fun. PhanTactical is a community that has come together to play ArmA in a semi-serious environment for over two years. By using a tailored suite of mods that enrich and enhance game play with new features, units, and terrains (ACE, TFAR, Op. Trebuchet, CUP Terrains/Weapons/Vehicles, Etc), An administration team that is open and flexible to always make sure the group and events are running as smoothly as possible.If you really want to have fun in this game - you should sign up @ www(dot)phantactical(dot)com. We have two sessions per week, every operation is a new experience.Here are the requirements to join PhanTactical:Own ArmA 3Have a Microphone (No exceptions to this rule.)Have a mindset ready for tactical and community based adventures18+ (No exceptions to this rule.)We hope to see you around!

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2
												If I can appraise Call of Duty for one thing, I don't know how they do it, stll manage to stay relevant in gaming.Gameinformer magazine and IGN alike giving this game the absurd 10/10 ratio that it's recieved just baffles my thinking process every time. Campaign : Aim down the sight and shoot. Think of that and your plot basically forms itself. Mulitplayer : My God, this is a ♥♥♥♥ing mess. Even during the Xbox 360 era, the Multiplayer was barely functional. Somehow the PC version seems even less playable.Good luck getting a server to play on your side by not making you download ♥♥♥♥ing ANYTHING. Even if you filter the mods section completely ♥♥♥♥ing off in your Server search menu, guess what? You STILL have to download on the most random of ♥♥♥♥ing server picks, hell, even if you turn downloads OFF it still manages to make you continue to download!I can't detail in words the frustration that came from attempting to play this travesty. Also, Punkbuster is a complete failure, don't be shocked. Apart from needing a Master's Degree in Rocket Science to figure out what server won't ruin your day, you finally get to the Multiplayer. Now, just imagine for a second, that this is your first time in about 2-3 years playing a shooter game that uses the same formula. Now imagine coming back to the series, and spend money on it no less, and notice how annoyingly frustrating it is to spawn on a map that has Sniper towers galore, and add the absurd spawn points to the equation and what we have, Ladies, Gentlemen, and Attack Helicopters alike, is something I'd dislike having to refer to again as : The worst pain you've felt in your life multiplyed by cancer. If rating this game is a thing the rating I would give it is a Widest 1 cm puddle in the gaming industry / Drinking Cyanide.End drunk rant.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												Honestly, I love this game. It has a great variety of guns, maps, and still has a thriving online community. I have over 25 hours logged online with my friends, so you can tell I at least like this game. However, this is where the fun stops. After many hours of constant grinding, I finally got up to level 55, the highest level, and I was overjoyed. Then, God decided I should be punished for being alive and decided to glitch out the game and reset my stats, back to level one. On top of that, there was an error message regarding a bad key code. (to clarify, I bought this game legally and did not download a cracked copy.) Since this game was from steam, there was no key code, and I was forced to reinstall. Since my friends were still playing the game at that point, I started the long climb to 55 again, and was once again greeted with a F*** you and a stat reset.I am writing this a warning to anyone who thinks this game looks fun, and just because I am butthurt, be prepared to start over every several days.8/10 gameplay-23456/10 for resets

content:
Posted: September 24, 2016
												My joint-favourite COD game with MW2, and one of my favourite of all time. It has aged very well and still has an active online-multiplayer community, albeit having many modded servers. Every COD since COD4 has tried to recreate the fantastic set-pieces and scenes featured in this, and have all fallen short of such greatness. It really makes sense that this COD of the entire series is the most deserving of a remaster. If you haven't played it yet, buy it. It's worth it.

number of helpful: 6 of 18 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 17, 2015
												The games a classic, lets remember it that way.I first purchased this game because my xbox 360 broke and wanted to re-live one of the classic call of duty's, pc gaming has always appealed to me more due to higher fps, better graphics etc, there's way more freedom, and this game  benefits from that over the console version, looks a lot sharper and is far more enjoyable.Maps such as the christmas crash is something consoles never had and is something different when first playing, more players per lobby, different modes and options for custom servers.However..The lack of servers available to play the old school way, as in the way it was intended, to play game by game and rank up one by one is next to none, very small amount of servers that host console game rules and even less that rotate maps, if you've only ever played on console think of it as playing a private match with a ten minuate timer and keep re-starting the game until you get to level 55.Also you cannot prestige in the PC version, i entered a lobby that has a custom xp per kill, got to 55 within a day, money wasted and game done with.Game now sits un-used install on my computer in the event I want to plug the xbox controller in and killer half n hour or so, always nice to go back to but never what it was.

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Bought this game purely because I read multiple descriptions from multiple sources that it was ''the best fps game ever''.I spent the entire game waiting for the game to start. It was infuriating. Every mission found like it was a slow, step-by-step tutorial. With the exception of RPGs, there was no need for weapon switching or experimentation as you were given the best primary for the mission each time.The story, though stated in other comments to be rich and exciting was dull.I would bother to elaborate, but I don't feel the game is worth my effort.TL;DR:-game is overrated.-story is boring-weaponry is boring-dogs are OP-missions are too linear-grenades are too OP+some mildly amusing voice lines during the credits+post credits mission was good (though I was still partly convinced that was actually the real first mission due to complete lack of depth)graphics - averagestory - badcharacters - averagemechanics - relatively poorability to replay - I have no desire to do so (non-existant) weaponry - very badBuy something else

content:
Posted: May 17, 2016
												This is an excellent game. However, I don't recommend this game for a number of reasons and I'm getting a refund. First of all, they're releasing a remastered version right away, but that's not why I don't recommend it! The reason is that World at War got an update letting you use a gamepad/xinput  with this game but this game still has stupid wasd movement even though it uses the exact same engine. I'll probably get the remastered version whenever I can after it comes out.
